contentList.content: Way of the Rubber Hide
Monks studied in the Way of the Rubber Hide focus their efforts on controlling their muscles and Ki to deflect enemy attacks and avoid damage.
Rubber Hide
Deflect Melee Attacks Charge
Deflect Spells Charge
Deflect Melee Attacks

Reduce the damage from a melee weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Attack.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
Deflect Melee Attacks
Absorb the blow from a melee weapon attack and reflect it back at your attacker.
Deflect Spells

Reduce the damage from a spell attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Spell.
You can only reduce damage from the spell - any additional effects can't be negated.
Deflect Spells
Absorb the force of a spell attack and reflect it back at your attacker.
Improved Unarmored Defense

Your training allows you to both dodge and absorb attacks. While not wearing armour, you add your Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> and your monk level to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Deflect Melee Attacks

Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a melee weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Melee Attack.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
Deflect Spells

Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a spell attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Ki Point to Deflect the Spell.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
Rubber Bounce
Your control over kinetic impacts to your body allow you to jump further. Your jump distance is increased by [1]
Rubber Knees
When you fall, you can now use your reaction to reduce fall damage by 75%.
Bounce Strike

When attacking with a monk weapon, you use the force of your initial attack to recoil and attack again for 1d4 of bludgeoning damage + the maximum of your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> or Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Double Bounce Strike

You are better able to control the force of your initial attack, resulting in double damage + 1d4 of bludgeoning damage + the maximum of your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> or Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Rubber Resistance
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Lightning, Thunder, and Bludgenoning damage.
Improved Rubber Resistance
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold and Slashing Damage.
Perfected Rubber Resistance
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire, Piercing, and Force Damage.
Deflect Spells
You return the force of the spell cast against you back onto your attacker as Bludgeoning damage.
Deflect Melee Attacks
You return the force of a melee attack against you back to the attacker as Bludgeoning damage.
Rubber Knees
You use your reaction to reduce fall damage by 75%.
